page.title: 17A day in my life - Part 1
page.content:
by Mrs Peggy Apperly
The sun shone through a gap in the curtains and another day began. the family was soon awake and I was the centre of attention for a few minutes opening my birthday cards and presents. I loved the home-made cards the children had secretly been creating. Having seen my husband off to work and the children off to school I joined a friend for the short journey to the local pick-your-own farm.We spent a happy hour picking strawberries for the school barn dance in the evening. The air was fresh and clear and the fruit so very plentiful and luscious. I could have stayed there all day. The rest of the morning disappeared amid the routine jobs about the house.
